testcase.name: Is your function named isNumeric with an input argument? isNumeric = function(x)
Is the input argument of your isNumeric function named x? isNumeric = function(x)
Did you remember the return statment?
Remember to use isNaN() and include the ! like this: return !isNaN(whatever)
Remember to use parseFloat() to fix the input of isNaN like this: return !isNaN(parseFloat(x))
The isFinite() function is required since the calculator is unable to handle inifinate numbers also to check with two functions use the && like this: return !isNaN(parseFloat(x)) && isFinite(x)
